Section I: Cover Sheet
Data ID
Participant ID
Before beginning the survey please remind the mother that they previously gave informed consent to take part in this survey about her delivery experience before being discharged.
INTRODUCE ENAP FOLLOW UP STUDY WITH FOLLOW UP INFORMATION SHEET AND CONSENT FORM: Does she consent to taking part in the follow up survey?

Date of Interview
Time of interview (24 hour clock)
Language used
Current condition of baby

Informed and signed consent

IF Q 12 ISNT KNOWN, FORCE ESTIMATE FOR AGE.

Section I.3 Current pregnancy history
During your pregnancy, did you know when your baby was due to be born?
a) What was the date? (dd/mm/yy) PROMPT: That is, during your pregnancy, what was the date that you were told your baby was due to be born?
Don’t know/don’t remember
PROMPT: That is, during your pregnancy, what was the date that you were told your baby was due to be born?
Do you know if any of these methods were used to calculate when your baby was due? READ ANSWER CHOICES AND USE VISUAL PROMPTS
How many weeks or months pregnant were you when you first received antenatal care for this pregnancy? DEPENDING ON MOTHER’S ANSWER, WRITE ANSWER IN EITHER WEEKS OR MONTHS
How many antenatal check-ups did you have? How many times did you receive antenatal care during this pregnancy?
How many week or months pregnant were you when you delivered your baby? DEPENDING ON MOTHER’S ANSWER, WRITE ANSWER IN EITHER WEEKS OR MONTHS
Section I.4 Perinatal data

Did a birth attendant listen for baby’s heart sounds during labour with an electric device (Doppler) or cone-shaped stethoscope placed on the abdomen ? USE VISUAL PROMPT AND DESCRIBE THE USE OF A CONE-LIKE INSTRUMENT

RadioButton.android:text: Yes, doppler or other machine to hear fetal heart rate
Yes, any device where midwife listens with device such as stethoscope, fetoscope or pinard

TextView.android:text: Were you told about the condition of your baby?
Where did you deliver your baby?
What date was your baby born? (dd/mm/yy)
Don’t know/don’t remember
What time was your baby born? (24 hrs clock)
Don’t know/don’t remember
Was the baby born by vaginal delivery, forceps, vacuum, assisted breach or caesarean section?
PROMPT FOR FORCEPS: that is, an instrument to help pull the baby out. PROMPT FOR VACUUM: that is, a suction to help pull the baby out?
When was the decision made to have the caesarean section? PROBE IF NECESSARY: Was it before or after your labour pains started?
Did anyone tell you the reason for the caesarean section?
a) If yes, then what was the reason?
Was your baby weighed at birth?
a) How much did your baby weigh? (grams)
Don’t know/don’t remember
How was your baby weighed? READ ANSWER CHOICES AND VISUAL PROMPT WITH PICTURES AS NECESSARY
Is your baby a boy or a girl?
When your baby was born, was (he/she) very large, larger than average, average, smaller than average, or very small?
Did you have any complications after birth?
What were the complications after birth?
a) Severe bleeding
b) Placenta retained
c) Convulsions for eclampsia
d) Bad-smelling Vaginal
e) Infection of Surgical Wound
f) Faint
g) High Fever (39-40c)
h) Breast Infection
i) Other
j) Don’t know/don’t remember
After your baby was born, how many nights did you stay in the hospital?
Don’t know/don’t remember
Did you receive a birth notification form or other relevant documentation to provide proof of the birth for your baby? SHOW FORM
In addition to this notification, a baby should also receive birth certification. Did you receive this form?
Do you know how to obtain such a birth certificate for your baby?

RadioButton.android:text: Do not know/ Do not remember

TextView.android:text: When are you planning to get your birth certificate? DEPENDING ON MOTHER’S ANSWER, WRITE ANSWER IN EITHER WEEKS OR MONTHS
Do you have any concerns about getting a birth certificate?
a) If yes, what are your concerns?
Other, specify
